Package project1

Class Shopping

java.lang.Object
project1.Shopping
public class Shopping
extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private ShoppingBag groceryBag  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Shopping()
    This constructor creates an instance of the Shopping class, by assigning a reference of a ShoppingBag object to the groceryBag datafield.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void addItem​(java.util.Scanner sc)
    Adds a GroceryItem item to the shopping bag.
    private void checkoutItems​(java.util.Scanner sc)
    Simulates checking out items at a grocery shop by first checking if the bag is empty or not.
    private void printItems​(java.util.Scanner sc)
    Prints the GroceryItems within our shopping bag by first checking for the size of the shopping bag.
    private void quitCheckout​(java.util.Scanner sc)
    Quits the shopping experience by checking out, if there are any items in the shopping bag, and quitting (regardless of the size of the shopping bag).
    private void removeItem​(java.util.Scanner sc)
    Removes a GroceryItem item from the shopping bag.
    void run()
    Scans in user input and process all add (A), remove (R), display (P), check out (C) and quit shopping (Q).

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • groceryBag

      private ShoppingBag groceryBag

  • Constructor Details

    • Shopping

      public Shopping()
      This constructor creates an instance of the Shopping class, by assigning a reference of a ShoppingBag object to the groceryBag datafield.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Scans in user input and process all add (A), remove (R), display (P), check out (C) and quit shopping (Q). It responds to invalid commands by printing out "Invalid command!"

    • addItem

      private void addItem​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Adds a GroceryItem item to the shopping bag. In order to add to shopping bag, it creates a new GroceryItem item by reading in the information provided by the input and adds it to groceryBag. Then, it prints out that this specific item has been added to the bag.
      Parameters:
      sc - (Scanner reads in input)

    • removeItem

      private void removeItem​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Removes a GroceryItem item from the shopping bag. In order to remove the element from the shopping bag, it first scans in the grocery items information and initializes a GroceryItem, and then removes this item by calling the remove method of shopping bag. If the item exists, it is removed, and the method returns the name of the item, its price and "removed." Else, if the item is not found in the bag, it returns "Unable to remove, this item is not in the bag."
      Parameters:
      sc - (Scanner reads in input)

    • printItems

      private void printItems​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Prints the GroceryItems within our shopping bag by first checking for the size of the shopping bag. If the size is 0, we print "The bag is empty!". If the size is 1, we indicate there is only one item in the bag; if there are several items, we print out how many items there are. After outputting the number of elements, we print all of the GroceryItem items out by calling the print method of ShoppingBag class.
      Parameters:
      sc - (Scanner reads in input)

    • checkoutItems

      private void checkoutItems​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Simulates checking out items at a grocery shop by first checking if the bag is empty or not. Then it prints all the items. After this, it prints out total price of all GroceryItem items and sales tax, along with the actual total due (the sum of total price and sales tax), followed by making the shopping bag empty, since all items have been processed.
      Parameters:
      sc - (Scanner reads in input)

    • quitCheckout

      private void quitCheckout​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Quits the shopping experience by checking out, if there are any items in the shopping bag, and quitting (regardless of the size of the shopping bag). If there are items in the shopping bag, we call the checkoutItems method, which simulates checking out, and then stop the shopping procedure by greeting. If there are no elements in the shopping bag, we just return the quit greeting ("Thanks for shopping with us!").
      Parameters:
      sc - (Scanner reads in input)
